edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.dc.api
Class DCReply

java.lang.Object
  edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.dc.api.DCReply

public class DCReply
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a reply from the DC server. It can be generated by passing specific values or from the raw bytes of a packet returned by a DC server. It also contains many usefule static constants related to fields found in DC reply messages.

Author:
Andrew Lake (alake@internet2.edu)

Constructor Detail

DCReply

public DCReply(DCMessageHeader header,
                 int type,
                 int length,
                 java.util.ArrayList<EROSubobject> ero,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> vtagList,
                 int errorCode)
Constructor that creates a DCReply object from passwed parameters for individual fields

Parameters:
header - a DCMessageHEader that represents the header of this new reply
type - the TLV type of the message body
length - the length of the message body excluding the length and type fields
ero - a list of EROSubobject that represent the explicite route object of the path
vtagList - a list of vtags derived from a vtag mask
errorCode - error code returned by server (0 if there is no error)

DCReply

public DCReply(byte[] packet)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Constructor that creates a DCReply object from the raw bytes of a packet returned by a DC server

Parameters:
packet - the packet returned by the server in raw byte form
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - thrown when ERO contains an IP address that is invalid
